definition: enemy/to be a match for/to rival/to resist/to withstand

sentences.english: Kitano musashi narrates the sea, how to lose how encounter tikal emperor god crossbow.
sentences.chinese: 北野武藏叙说海上如何遭遇劲敌，如何失去天皇神弩。

sentences.english: He got his men into a tight huddle before they took on arch-rivals Spain.
sentences.chinese: 在面临劲敌西班牙之前，他召集他的人开了一个短会。

sentences.english: So far, the two sides have been arch- enemies.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，双方已成为劲敌。

sentences.english: Television has proved a tough competitor for advertising to the newspaper industry.
sentences.chinese: 在广告电视表明是报刊业的劲敌。

sentences.english: But India takes a dim view of China's cooperation with archrival Pakistan.
sentences.chinese: 不过，印度对中国与其劲敌巴基斯坦的合作不以为然。

sentences.english: This makes Google into Apple’s archrival in a way it never was before.
sentences.chinese: 这让谷歌成为苹果前所未有的劲敌。

sentences.english: With this, they represent Islam as if it is an arch-enemy of advancement and progress.
sentences.chinese: 这样做，只是在把伊斯兰描述为进步与发展的劲敌。

sentences.english: Host beach spikers turn formidable rivals to topple in the Asian Games.
sentences.chinese: 亚运会上，东道主的沙滩排球选手击垮了他们的劲敌。

definition: opponent/substantial adversary/worthy match/antagonist/in the enemy's hands
to win as a result of tenacious effort/to fight off tough competition
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)/overlord/hegemon
(literary) to be routed (in a war)/to suffer defeat (in sports etc)
to pit oneself against sb/to compete with sb/contest/battle/to haggle/to quibble
to be utterly defeated/to be routed
